meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Here's my review of Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling - a game that's got everyone else swooning!

Let me just say, I'm not exactly the otome genre's biggest fan. I mean, I've played them before, but they always leave me feeling like I just devoured an entire box of chocolates - all sweet and fluffy on the surface, but ultimately leaving me with a stomachache and a sense of emptiness.

But, Sweet and Spicy Darling is different. It's like someone took all those annoying chocolate cravings away and replaced them with a delightful surprise party in my gaming soul!

The first thing that struck me was how seamlessly this sequel connected to the original Cupid Parasite. I mean, NintendoWorldReport said it best - it's like Pokemon Platinum to Diamond and Pearl; the second game takes everything good from the first and amplifies it tenfold! And with those reminder points sprinkled throughout, even newcomers can hop on and enjoy the ride without feeling lost.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "But what about the storytelling?" Well, let me tell you, God is a Geek wasn't far off when they said this game is all about mixing and matching. The stories are just as engaging as the original, with plenty of exciting set pieces to keep things fresh and spicy!

And hey, I've got to give credit where credit is due - Digitally Downloaded nailed it when they said this game is all about aesthetics and presentation. I mean, the visuals are stunning! It's like a beautifully crafted box of chocolates, full of surprises and treats waiting to be discovered.

But, let's not forget about those endings! Tech-Gaming got it right when they said we're talking "compelling codas" here. I won't spoil anything, but trust me when I say that the choices you make throughout the game can lead to some pretty surprising conclusions.

Of course, no review would be complete without mentioning Gamer Escape's criticisms about world-building and character development. Now, I'm not saying they're wrong - the game does feel a bit lacking in those areas. But hey, at least we've got GLHF on Sports Illustrated to provide some balance with their mixed feelings about the game.

All in all, Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is a delightful surprise that's sure to please even the most skeptical otome fans out there. So, go ahead and indulge in this sugary treat - your gaming soul will thank you!

Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got some serious playing to do...
